Class EventScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.usecases.EventScheduler

  • public class EventScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    The EventScheduler helps to check conflicts between two events.
    Since:
    2020-12-20
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Haoze Huang

                                 java.time.LocalDateTime newTime)
        Return true iff the input newTime has the same date as the pre-scheduled event's time.
        Parameters:
        scheduledEvent - a scheduled Event
        newTime - of the new-added Event
        Returns:
        ture iff the newTime has the same date as the scheduledEvent's time.

      • checkConflictTime

        public boolean checkConflictTime(Event event,
                                 java.time.LocalDateTime time,
                                 int duration)
        Return true iff the input time and duration of an Event is conflict with the scheduled event.
        Parameters:
        event - that already scheduled
        time - of the newly input event
        duration - of the newly input event
        Returns:
        true when there is a conflict

      • getEndTime

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getEndTime(java.time.LocalDateTime time,
                                                                    int duration)
        Return A map whose key are "hour" and "min", representing the hour and min of the end time of the event.
        Parameters:
        time - of the event
        duration - of the event
        Returns:
        a map representation of the end time of the event

      • checkConflictSpeaker

        public boolean checkConflictSpeaker(Event e1,
                                    Event e2)
        Return true iff there exists a speaker in Event e1 also is in Event e2.
        Parameters:
        e1 - Event #1
        e2 - Event #2
        Returns:
        true if they contains the same speaker(s).

      • isConflict

        public boolean isConflict(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Event> schedule,
                          Event event,
                          java.time.LocalDateTime t,
                          java.lang.String r,
                          int d)
        Return true iff there exists a conflict.
        Parameters:
        schedule - that contains all scheduled events.
        event - that already scheduled.
        t - time of the want-to-add event.
        r - roomId of the want-to-add event.
        d - duration of the want-to-add event.
        Returns:
        true iff the t,r,d of the want-to-add event has time and room/speaker conflicts with the pre-scheduled event.
